```{r}
# reading in file/data

library(readr)

file <- "C:/Users/lissa/Downloads/U.S._Chronic_Disease_Indicators__CDI___2023_Release.csv"
data <- read.csv(file)

```

```{r}
# Load dplyr
library(tidyverse)

# Janitor package helps with lots of naming fixes
library(janitor)
```

```{r}
# creating a tibble

tbl_data <- tibble(data)

tbl_data
```



```{r}
sub_data <- select(tbl_data, YearStart, LocationDesc, Topic, Question, StratificationCategory1, Stratification1, DataSource)

sub_data
```


```{r}
# Filtering data
fil_data <- filter(sub_data, DataSource == "Death Certificate", StratificationCategory1 == "Gender")

fil_data

```
```{r}
# Check which types of Cancers killed the most, and where + when 

pull(fil_data, "LocationDesc") %>% table()

data
length(unique(fil_data$LocationDesc))


```
